results.title: ‘Now and Then’ at 25: Girlhood Finally Taken Seriously
results.abstract: This movie about inseparable tweens and the grown-ups they became was dismissed in 1995. Today it’s cherished by waves of new fans for the weight it gives their stories.

results.title: Want a Halloween Thriller as Daring as ‘Psycho’? Try ‘Peeping Tom’
results.abstract: Michael Powell’s disturbing chronicle of a murderous filmmaker was ahead of its time, influencing Martin Scorsese, Brian De Palma and Kathryn Bigelow.

multimedia.caption: Brenda Bruce as a victim caught in the cross-hairs of a viewfinder in “Peeping Tom” (1960), which, along with “Psycho” the same year, pushed the boundaries of the audience-screen relationship.

results.title: Tony Todd on the Joy of ‘Candyman,’ and the Role of Black Horror
results.abstract: Frightening movies help fans gain a “new understanding,” says the veteran star of scary stories, including the new “Tales From the Hood 3.”

multimedia.caption: Despite his extensive theater background, Todd is known for horror movies, but he doesn’t mind: The genre is “passionately adored — so I don’t see it as a secondhand citizenship.”
multimedia.copyright: Clifford Prince King for The New York Times

results.title: ‘We Cannot Kill That Little Chihuahua’: Actor’s Puppy Crusade Shines Light on Global Trade
results.abstract: The action star Jean-Claude Van Damme intervened to save a Bulgarian dog from euthanasia after Norway said it had been imported on a fake passport.

multimedia.caption: The actor Jean-Claude Van Damme made a Facebook video about the plight of Raya, a 3-month-old Chihuahua who faced euthanasia in Norway after apparently being trafficked from Bulgaria.
